title: Closed tabs keep reopening leaving more and more and more open at a time
content: IDK what topic this is! When I close tabs but later restart the browser or come out of "sleep" - they are repoened. I'm not talking about the ones I left open. I closed them and they don't stay that way. They insert themselves into their original positions as if I had told them to reopen, and accumulate. I want them gone please :O( This has been going on for years.
creator: HappyAdvocate

title: Firefox menu is missing several items
content: How do I get Firefox menu to show all options? Can’t customize toolbar, there is no “more tools” or “options” available.
creator: mbell828

title: Supposed fix to stop searches from popping to urlbar doesn't work
content:
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1284577 does not work on my new W11 laptop. I've asked before and received no answer, so maybe things will be different this time.

Are there any other instructions that might work?
creator: ithinktfiam

title: Session Lost due to Firefox Crash
content: Hi, my session with a lot of open tabs has been lost due to a crash. In the profile folder, the recovery and previous files in the sessionstore-backups have been deleted. I tried to recover them using shadow explorer, but these files are corrupted, so I've had no success reading them. Is there a way to fix the corrupted files? Alternatively, because I've had sync enabled for open tabs, is there a log for past open tab synchronizations? If this was stored on the cloud, it may be possible to retrieve that table and restore the list of open tabs that way?
creator: Darkmight11

title: My Facebook account has been suspended
content:
Hello Facebook Team, When i login my Facebook account i find this problem that;

We received your information Check your email for an update on your request, and to find out what other information we need. title: Firefox Update
content: Hi James Your reply does not answer my question - "Could you please advise a work-around to allow me to continue to use Firefox V 94.0.1 reliably after 25 March 2025". Thank you. Also FYI, I indicated that I was continuing to use Firefox V 94.0.1 (64-bit) on Windows 7 Professional. This is because all versions later than 94.0.1 modified settings which had to be reset after an update. This was not necessary up to and including V 94.0.1 Cheers Graham Garden
creator: grahamgarden
